8.7.20  5:44 pm   How far are along are you with your next song? Like 50%?
24.345%?

8.7.20  5:33 pm   tell us about your relationship with times new roman

      most of my site is fontless, so it uses your browser's default font. and my browser's default font happens to be times new roman. i hadn't really used it very much before, but i started to like it a little bit. so i may have used it in some videos since then. Then i researched a little bit about the history and found out that it was kind of a miracle font when it came out. no one had seen something with quite so much 'sparkle' to it. and then i started buying into the hype, especially after seeing what other fonts were around before that

8.7.20  9:19 am   I've got many things to do but I dont know which one to do first so I just end up doing nothing. Can you help me figure out a method of solving this? Thanks in advance 

      here's what i would recommend, based on similar long term problems i've had, and the best solution that has emerged. it's a hybrid randomization scheme. First, put all the items in a list. 2 different approaches come to mind- 1: using complete randomization to pick (computer generated random selection), but this might end up picking one that you actually don't really want to do. 2: 'just picking the one you want' clearly doesn't work, otherwise you wouldn't be in this situation. So i've found a hybrid system: the way it works is, first you go through the list and choose ones that you think are reasonable choices -- it's ok to pick as many as you want. Add these to a finalists list. then, immediately as soon as you finish making that list, do a random selection based on that new list. And that's your selection. If you don't end up choosing any for the finalists list, then go ahead and just do the random selection on the original list. i hope this helps. i think it is a solid system and it works for me, even in the face of extreme decision anxiety

8.7.20  5:09 am   I don't know when the pelican ages were or what the heck pelican level aesthetics are, but I really doubt they will ruin the energy and expression you pour into your work. I just found out about you around the time that disease season became a thing, and experiencing what you have created and reading the questions page has been very meaningful and enjoyable to me in a bunch of ways. I guess what I am saying is I would ride with you through the pelican ages to the muskrat millennium, even if there are failures along the way. Even if there are other long periods of working on stuff other than content. Thanks for your work and for being you. I suspect lots of others feel the same but maybe you don't hear it because they don't want to bug you. The dear folks who ask when the new video is coming might also mean the same thing, now that I think about it. Oops, no question, sorry!

      holy incremental improvement regimen, you are very friendly
